# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df := hcat(df, mapcolumn(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyymm"), x -> x.dt) .|> Int64, :ym)
    df
end
```

This `add_yearmonth` function accepts a DataFrame as an argument and creates a new column `ym` by applying the given transformation to each element of the `dt` column. The transformation uses the `Dates.format()` function to get the year and month as a string and then converts it to an `Int64` using `mapcolumn()` and the `|>` pipe operator.
